meanings.definition: To surpass in prayer or supplication.
meanings.sent1: She always outprays her friends during group prayers.
meanings.sent2: He outprays everyone in the church with his heartfelt prayers.
meanings.sent3: The little girl outprays her cat every night before bedtime.
meanings.sent4: Her devotion outprays the doubts that linger in her mind.
meanings.sent5: His voice outprays the silence of the empty church.

meanings.definition: To pray more fervently or effectively than someone else.
meanings.sent1: The monk outprays his fellow brothers with his unwavering faith.
meanings.sent2: She outprays her family members with her sincere prayers for them.
meanings.sent3: The old man outprays the noisy birds outside his window every morning.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outprays any obstacles that come her way.
meanings.sent5: His passion outprays the indifference of the crowd around him.
